poll_list.title: Short Ratification Poll for Requesting Protocol DAI Transfer to Fund Endgame Information Portal (MIP14c2-SP3) - January 30, 2023

discourse_list.title: MIP14c2-SP3: Requesting Protocol DAI Transfer to Fund Endgame Information Portal

content.content: MIP14c2-SP3: Requesting Protocol DAI Transfer to Fund Endgame Information Portal  Preamble MIP14c2-SP#: 3 Author(s): @rspa Contributors:twblack88 Tags: Endgame, JokeDAO Status: Rejected Date Proposed: 2023-01-10 Date ratified: N/A Forum URL: https://forum.makerdao.com/t/mip14c2-spx-requesting-protocol-dai-transfer-to-fund-endgame-information-portal/19370 Ratification Poll URL: https://vote.makerdao.com/polling/QmcwMMVc --- Amount: 9,999 DAI   Specification  Sentence Reason Currently, information about the Endgame Plan and transition is fragmented and exists in a plethora of forum posts, often with multiple versions and their comments, Discord messages, and Youtube videos of Zoom call recordings. The proposed funding will finance development of an information portal with good search capabilities and —ideally— decentralized storage.  Reason Details The funding will be for the winner of a JokeDAO contest to implement the best proposed solution for an Endgame information portal. The reward is 9,999 DAI. The underlying voting tokens have already been distributed to MKR holders, delegates, and CU members for the last JokeDAO contest. The JokeDAO entrants should submit a proposal containing:  The title of their proposed solution. What the solution would look like (sketches, MVPs, or previous work encouraged). How they’d implement their proposed solution (e.g., technical architecture or no-code platforms). A timeframe, milestones if needed, and the due date for delivery.  There are three steps:  Passing this Maker native proposal, the JokeDAO entry submissions, and the voting (on JokeDAO).  If this proposal passes, the solution race will last for two weeks after the ratification of this proposal. Finding a winner during voting will last for one week. The winner will get paid 9,999 DAI to implement the solution. Payout will be done by the JokeDAO smart contracts via the rewards feature. We propose paying out 1k immediately after the winner is elected and 8,999 DAI after successfully completing the proposal to safeguard funds. JokeDAO is working with the authors to find a solution to automate these payouts as much as possible.  DAI Transfer Ceiling Analysis The proposed transfer is within the parameters of the Protocol DAI Transfer Ceiling (250,000 DAI).  Targets The recipient is the smart contract for the JokeDAO contest. The address is TBA. Recipient Address: TBA Amount To Transfer: 9,999 DAI
content.GPT-summary: The post is a proposal for funding the development of an information portal for the Endgame Plan and transition. The proposal outlines the steps for a JokeDAO contest to find the best solution for the portal, with a reward of 9,999 DAI. The post explains the details of the proposal, including the transfer of funds and the requirements for the contest. The post also invites questions and criticism, and advertises the proposal to the MakerDAO community.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
3rd party or author is advertising proposal

content.content: This is a summary of the contents of this subproposal and its impact, from GovAlpha’s perspective:  This is a valid subproposal to request a DAI transfer from the Maker Protocol, as defined in MIP14: Protocol DAI Transfer. This proposal uses JokeDAO to host a contest. Contestants will propose solutions to design the user interface and backend of a portal that would host Endgame-related information. The winning entry would be awarded 9,999 DAI to create the proposed portal. This fee is only to create the portal and does not include any content. As per MIP14c2, transfers under 10,000 DAI have no Feedback Period or Frozen Period. If this subproposal is ratified, the contest will last for two weeks and voting will last a further one week. The winner will get paid 1,000 DAI immediately and a further 8,999 DAI after they implement their solution. MKR holders, CU members and Recognized Delegates have already been airdropped voting tokens that they may use for this competition. This proposal has been assigned Medium-Impact based on the methodology listed here.  Disclaimer: These summaries are intended to be a guide and not a source of truth. You remain responsible for any actions you take on the grounds of this information. Please note the date when the summary was last updated to judge accuracy. Updated 2023-01-14
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: My alternative suggestion is to build it into the Maker Operational Manual as a new section that is very actively updated. I am against new sites; they fragment info and make it hard to find. Let’s build info into existing resource hubs.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: Does this proposal include providing content as well? Or just the UI? If it’s for content as well, then I’m not sure 9,999 DAI is going to get you a high-quality output. For comparison, the Manual has taken many hours of work, including quality control and review time, and Endgame is an order of magnitude more complex.     Davidutro:  My alternative suggestion is to build it into the Maker Operational Manual   IMO it should not be added to the MOM as that detracts from the MOM’s role as a resource for Governance participants. However, GovAlpha and SES are collaborating on providing some Endgame documentation which will be added to the overview list in the MOM here:  This is very much in the preliminary phase but we hope to have the first few entries live this month.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: Patrick_J:  Does this proposal include providing content as well? Or just the UI?   Great catch, Patrick.  It’s for the platform only (UI and backend). Not for the content. I hope contributors will move it there on their own.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: I’m not sure this is ideal. But open to let the community decide. The Maker manual is a good candidate to nominate for the JokeDAO contest.

Just a note that we will be entering this proposal into the weekly cycle today. The feedback period for MIP14 Subproposals that are less than 10,000 DAI is 0. This has therefore been met. Although entry into the weekly vs. monthly cycle is not specified in MIP14 for smaller proposals, GovAlpha feels it is appropriate for the proposal to enter the weekly cycle. In our opinion, it is clear that the MIP authors intended to reduce friction and increase speed for more minor requests like this one.

rspa:  Great catch, Patrick. It’s for the platform only (UI and backend). Not for the content. I hope contributors will move it there on their own.   This seems wasteful. The content is more important than a platform, the content can be hosted anywhere. chatgpt can probably build a platform or come close, no need to waste $10k

content.content: vigilant:  This seems wasteful. The content is more important than a platform, the content can be hosted anywhere. chatgpt can probably build a platform or come close, no need to waste $10k   If you can build a great, easy-to-access platform with good search capabilities for 0, please enter the JokeDAO contest. I’m certain your proposition will win.
